p:
Given the above situation, the objectives of this study are:
To document the medicinal folk knowledge about wild plants and highlight shared and divergent knowledge of use between transhumant communities around Georgia-Turkey border, as well as comparing the knowledge with the ethnomedicinal literature sources.
To evaluate the cultural significance of the most salient plant families, genera, species, and their medicinal uses among participants in Georgia and in Turkey. Furthermore, the underlying factors of use/knowledge patterns for these plant species will be discussed.
